title: High-Throughput Plastic Localization Measurements by Multi-Beam SEM Imaging
content: Recent advancements in experimental measurement that integrate nano-scale deformation measurement over millimeter-scale fields of view offer insights into how material structure and microstructure control the mechanical properties of metallic materials [1]. These technologies include high-resolution digital image correlation (HR-DIC) via scanning electron microscopy, automated nano-indentation, high-throughput mechanical testing of small specimens, and high-speed atomic force microscopy. They provide a detailed observation of deformation processes and can capture the complex microstructural effects of metallic materials by examining large surface or volume areas. These tools are crucial for understanding the variability in microstructure at different scales and how it influences deformation and the overall mechanical properties of materials.
